data.title: Woody Allen and the allegations that won’t go away
data.meta_description: It was supposed to be Woody Allen’s big comeback. Blue Jasmine, nominated for three Baftas and three Oscars, has been hailed as his greatest movie in years. At the age of 78 his appetite for
data.text:
It was supposed to be Woody Allen’s big comeback. Blue Jasmine, nominated for three Baftas and three Oscars, has been hailed as his greatest movie in years. At the age of 78 his appetite for film-making remains undiminished and this spring had promised to be a season of enormous professional satisfaction for the veteran director. Last month he was feted with the Cecil B. DeMille Award for lifetime achievement at the Golden Globes, while at the Academy Awards next month he is up for Best Original Screenplay, Cate Blanchett is a contender for Best Actress and Briton Sally Hawkins for Best Supporting Actress.

But nomination lists only tell a fragment of the story. His Golden Globes Award was overshadowed by eviscerating tweets from his
